question: What are the names of disaster projects starting later than 2022?
evidence_answer: Broad Beach Road Water Quality Infrastructure Repairs.

Vehicle Protection Devices

(cid:190) Project Description: Per Malibu Municipal Code Section 17.48.070 requires
vehicle impact protection devices to be installed for all parking spaces
located adjacent to any outdoor pedestrian seating area.

There are two
locations within the City’s right-of-way and City-owned property that would
require a vehicle impact protection device.

The project consists of hiring a consultant to develop
a plan that includes the evaluation of a siren system and possible locations.

intersection floods and causes debris to block the road.

drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures
within the City.

Outdoor Warning Sirens (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA
after the Wooley Fire.

The City will
apply for future grant funding for this phase of the project. (cid:190) Upates:

An extended storm
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue.

The City has been
awarded a FEMA Hazard Mitigation grant to fund the design, engineering and
environmental compliance needed for a shovel ready project.

The project consists of hiring a consultant to develop
a plan that includes the evaluation of a siren system and possible locations.

the Emergency Warning Sirens project will be implementation of the design
plan, including purchasing, installing, and testing the sirens.

During storms, this
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road.

Phase One of the project included a sound study to
determine the optimal number and locations of individual sirens, power and
infrastructure requirements, and siren sound range.

In March, the City be seeking
proposals from consultants to perform construction management.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021
